description: '''Jay''' or '''James Arthur''' "'''Jimmy'''" '''Rogers''' (June 3, 1924{{snd}}December 19, 1997) was an American [[Chicago blues]] singer, guitarist and harmonica player, best known for his work as a member of [[Muddy Waters]]'s band in the early 1950s.{{sfn|Russell|1997|p=161}} He also had a solo career and recorded several popular blues songs, including "[[That's All Right (Jimmy Rogers song)|That's All Right]]" (now a [[blues standard]]), "Chicago Bound", "Walking by Myself" (his sole R&B chart appearance), and "Rock This House".{{sfn|Dahl|1996|p=226}} He withdrew from the music industry at the end of the 1950s, but returned to recording and touring in the 1970s.
